She will use the money from this loan to buy chickens, Guinea pigs, and feed.  She will also buy fabric and thread for her home business.  Her goal is to have a larger workshop.

loans.use: to buy small animals, feed, and other supplies.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Nathalia vive en la ciudad de Jayanca, es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que con mucho esfuerzo logro iniciar su negocio de venta de abarrotes y cervezas desde hace varios meses, con lo cual tiene ingresos para poder solventar los gastos del hogar, Natalia trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy amable con los clientes.

Natalia esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ay que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como arroz, azúcar, pro saco, fideos, entre otros y de esta manera mejorara sus ingresos y luchar por hacer realidad su sueño:” Tener un minimarket”.
texts.en:
Nathalia lives in the city of Jayanca.  She is a woman who is eager to get ahead.  That's why she put forth a lot of effort and started her own business.  

She has sold beers and groceries for many months, with which she can cover the costs of her home.  She works about 10 hours per day and believes that she does well with her work because she is very friendly to customers.  

Natalia is grateful to Kiva lenders, and as a result of their help, she can purchase goods for her business like rice, sugar, bags, noodles, etc.  This will help her to improve her incomes and fight to make her dream of having a mini-market a reality.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to purchase supplies for her sewing business.

Lilia has been in this business for 45 years. She earns more income from selling charcoal.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her sewing business.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita works hard to support her family. Amelita is married and has a 'buy and sell' firewood business in the Philippines.

Amelita requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of firewood to sell.

Amelita has been in this business for 7 years now.

In the future, Amelita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of firewood to sell

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Carmelita is 53 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Carmelita has a abacca weaving business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional raw materials like abacca fiber, etc. for her business.

Carmelita has been in this business for five years. In the future, Carmelita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials like abacca (plant) fiber, etc. for her business

loans.name: Dina Estela

texts.es: Dina de  26 años de edad, reside en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijas de 8 años y 5 años de edad. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado adecuar un pequeño negocio de medicamentos dentro de su casa. En su negocio vende variedad de medicina como: vitaminas, pastillas para el dolor, jarabe para la toz, pomadas para los hongos, alcohol, etc. Su deseo es ver crecer su negocio por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en su inventario de medicamentos y así poder cubrir una mayor demanda de sus productos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
Dina is 26 years old. She lives in her own home with her life partner and their daughters, who are 8 and 5. With great effort, she has been able to start a small business selling medicine out of her home. At her business, she sells a variety of medicine like, vitamins, pain medication, cough syrup, ointments for fungus, alcohol, etc. 

Her dream is to grow her business, which is why she has requested this loan from FUSAI. She will use the loan to invest in medicine so that she will be able to cover the greater demand for her products and she will also be able to improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, pain medicine, cough syrup, ointments for fungus, alcohol, etc.

loans.name: Precila

texts.en:
Precila is 63 years old and widowed with ten children. Precila works very hard to provide for them.

Precila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Precila has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as bread, chips, soft drinks, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Precila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gladys Eufemia

texts.es:
La Señora Gladys forma parte del grupo de crédito Futuro para un Bienestar, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se encuentra formada por hermosos pasisajes su centro histórico guarda celosamente la historia de la ciudad, su gente aun mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
Doña Gladys tiene 55 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos están casados pero solo uno vive independiente, su otro hijo casado vive en su casa compartiendo los gastos del hogar, su hija soltera también trabaja y ayuda a la economía de la casa. Su esposo labora como instructor de manejo, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
La Señora Gladys  pasa en casa realizando los quehaceres de su hogar pero para aportar a la economía de su casa se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos, lleva 4 años en el negocio y le gusta mucho porque le ha dado la independencia económica para mejorar la estabilidad de su hogar, también se dedica a la crianza de pollos. 
El dinero de su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de ropa, su nuevo crédito va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos de oferta, ropa y en más pollos. En los pagos de su crédito anterior no ha tenido dificultad alguna por lo que realiza en las fechas correspondientes. Su grupo de crédito le gusta por la unión, solidaridad y carisma de su grupo.
texts.en:
Gladys is part of a loan group called Futuro para un Bienestar.  She lives in Cuenca.  This city is formed by beautiful landscapes with its historical center guarding the history of the city.  Its people still maintain the culture and traditions of their communities.  

Gladys is 55 years old, married, and in her marriage has conceived 3 adult children.  Two of them are married but only one lives independently.  Her other married child lives in her home, sharing the costs of living.  Her daughter also works and helps with the financial needs of the home.  Her husband works as a driving instructor.  They do not own their own home but they rent one.    

Gladys spends her time at home doing chores, but to help with the economy of the home, works selling clothing and cosmetics.  She has worked for 4 years in this business and likes it a lot because it gives her financial independence to improve the stability of her home.  She also works raising chickens.  

The money from her past loan was invested in buying clothing.  Her new loan will help her to buy cosmetics, clothing, and more chickens.  She did not have any difficulty paying back her last loan on the corresponding dates.

She likes the unity, solidarity, and charisma of her loan group.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, clothing, and chickens

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
This is Emma, 34, a resident of Batasa, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Richard, a truck driver, and she is a mother to her  children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
  
Emma operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. They sell these to junk shops for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries like factories and others of the like. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php1000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be incorporating the loan into her current revolving fund used to buy recyclable materials from collectors. 

Emma dreams of expanding her business and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
La Joven María del Rosario tiene 24 años de edad, vive en un barrio de Tegucigalpa, en el centro de Honduras, tiene 2 hijos y vive con su esposo,  se dedica desde hace 3 años a la venta de tortillas, se levanta muy temprano todos los días para elaborarlas y luego sale a entregarlas a sus clientes. 
María del Rosario es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de un comal, harina y leña materiales que necesita para la elaboración de su producto y de esta forma poder seguir con sus ventas y cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes.
María del Rosario espera que la inversión que realice a su negocio le genere las utilidades suficientes para poder salir adelante con su familia  y a la vez espera que su negocio siga creciendo.
María del Rosario su sueño es siempre poder darle a sus hijos una buena educación y que estos tengan mejores oportunidades.


Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Octubre del 2013
texts.en:
María del Rosario is 24 years old and lives in a neighborhood in Tegucigalpa, in the central part of Honduras. She has two children and lives together with her husband. Her business since three years back is to sell tortillas. She gets up early in the morning to cook them and the she goes out to deliver them to her clients. 

María del Rosario is a hard-working and enterprising woman. She needs this loan in order to buy a frying pan, flour, and firewood. She will use these items to prepare her product, so that she can continue her sales and fulfill her clients' orders.

María del Rosario hopes that this investment in her business will generate enough income to move her and her family forward, and she hopes that her business will continue growing. Her dream is to be able to give her children a good education so that they will have better opportunities.

Tegucigalpa, Honduras – October 2013

loans.use: to buy a frying pan, flour, and firewood

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita, 56, a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Tomas, a mason. She, together with her husband, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.
  
Nenita operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during the evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition, but also a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons, when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Nenita also has a variety store for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products, such as meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and frozen food products. 

Nenita dreams to expand her business and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients, such as rice, pork, chicken, and vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia is from San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is married and has two children. Clemencia prepares and sells cooked food for daily meals for a living. Aside from this, she is also engaged in selling ready-to-wear used clothing in town. 

Her previous loan from GDMPC used in her food selling was successfully repaid. She borrowed a new loan recently to purchase additional used clothing to resell. She wants to expand her business, and hopefully improve the general living situation of the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional used clothing to resell.

loans.name: Sari Mertha Group

texts.en:
Because the prices of feeds are high enough, the Sari Mertha group went on a loan with the same amount. At the time of disbursement of funds in the field, 2 members could not attend due to attending ceremony at the temple. Ni Luh, as the head, couldn't attend the meeting because she had a religious ceremony at her home, and the treasurer of the group represented her to receive the loan. Each member gets 1,500,000 IDR. The loan will be used to buy super quality piglets and feed.

Ni Luh use the loan to buy quality feed to increase the growth of the pigs. To reduce costs, she still gives the mixture feeds. She hopes the pigs will grow healthy and not attacked by disease. If she already has enough savings to venture capital, she will raise pigs with her own capital.

loans.use: to buy quality feed to increase the growth of the pigs.

loans.name: Kosal

texts.en:
Kosal, a hardworking, married woman, is 27 years old and a rice farmer in Moung Ruessei district, Battambang province. She cultivates a two-hectare plot of farmland, primarily growing rice both for sustenance and sales. She is happy because her husband is very supportive in helping her to manage their farm. Through their efforts, they are able to make an income of $10.00 a day each.

Kosal wants to have household energy at a reduced monthly cost by purchasing a solar energy home system. Due to inadequate funds, she has requested a loan in the amount of 700 US dollars from Kiva through its partner, HKL. After this initial investment, Kosal hopes to have clean energy to power her household lights, TV and radio. 

Kosal is very happy and thankful because with this loan, HKL has provided her a special interest rate lower than its general loan rates. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system for her home.

loans.name: Buscando El  Éxito  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Buscando el Éxito está formado por 12 socias quienes viven por el alrededor de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se encuentra rodeada de una geografía accidentada, esta bañada por 4 ríos, es cuna de grandes deportistas y artistas. Las socias son mujeres quienes se esfuerzan el día a día para salir adelante con sus familias, sus negocios y su trabajo les da la oportunidad de superación, a pesar de las dificultades que pueden tener a diario siempre están con una sonrisa y un buen carisma, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos las que les inculcaron sus padres
Una de las socias de este grupo es la  Señora. Mariuxi, se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza a lado de sus amigas y vecinas del grupo de crédito Buscando el Éxito, le gusta esta forma de créditos ya que todas sus compañeras y amigas son unidas.
La Señora Mariuxi tiene 25 años, vive en unión libre y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido dos hijos de 8 y 6 años de edad, su esposo labora como empleado privado, la casa en la que viven es propia.
Doña Mariuxi labora en un mercado de la ciudad donde se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace un año, en este negocio labora de domingo a domingo. 
El dinero de su crédito va a  invertir en la compra de víveres y vajilla para su negocio. Su meta es comprarse un vehículo.
texts.en:
The Buscando el Éxito (Searching for Success) communal bank is made up of 12 female members who live near the city of Cuenca, a city which is surrounded by a rugged terrain through which four rivers flow, and it is the birthplace of famous sportsmen and artists. 

The members are women who work hard from day to day to get ahead in life with their families and their business, and their work gives them the opportunity to better themselves. Despite the difficulties that they may have every day, they always wear a smile and have their charisma. They still maintain the culture and traditions from their towns which they were taught by their parents.

One of the members of this group is Mariuxi, who is seeking her second loan together with her friends and neighbors from the Buscando el Éxito loan group. She likes this type of loans as all of her colleagues and friends are united. Mariuxi is 25 years old, she lives in a common-law partnership and has two children aged 8 and 6 as the fruit of this marriage. Her husband works as a private employee, and the home in which they live is their own. 

Mariuxi has been working in a market in the city for the last year where she sells food, working from Sunday to Sunday in this business. 
She will invest the money from this loan in the purchase of basic goods and dishes for her business. Her aim is to buy herself a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy basic goods and dishes.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
Basilia tiene 48 años, trabaja como personal de limpieza de un supermercado de su ciudad, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para poder apoyar a su esposo a sacar adelante a su familia.

Basilia esta agradecida con el apoyo que le brindan los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a esta ayuda podrá apoyar a su esposo en la compra de uniforme y implementos para su trabajo de seguridad, de esta manera su esposo no tendrá problemas en su trabajo y podrá seguir luchando para hacer realidad su sueño:” Mejorar su calidad de vida”.
texts.en:
Basilia is 48 years old and works as a custodian in a supermarket in town.  This allows her to have an income so she can help her husband get the family ahead.

Basilia is grateful for the support she is getting from the Kiva lenders, because thanks to this she will be able to help her husband buy uniform and other items for his work as a security guard.  This way her husband will not have any problems at work, will be able to have an income, and they can continue toward their dream, “Improving their quality of life.”

loans.use: to buy a uniform.

loans.name: Las Amelias  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Las Amelias está formado por 7 socias y 1 socio, quienes viven por el alrededor de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad tiene una belleza natural ya que cuenta con grandes paisajes gracias a su geografía accidentada, esta bañada por 4 ríos, su Centro Histórico guarda celosamente la historia de esta hermosa ciudad. Las socias son personas amables y gentiles, que luchan el día a día para mejorar la estabilidad de sus hogares y así sacar adelante a sus familias, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Mercedes, está en su cuarto crédito que realiza a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito Las Amelias, le gusta este tipo de crédito por la unión y solidaridad de todas sus compañeras y amigas ya que más que un grupo han conformado una familia, siempre se apoyan.
La Señora María Mercedes tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos, cinco son casadas y viven independientes, un hijo soltero trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, su otro hijo está estudiando en la universidad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
Doña María Mercedes trabaja de domingo a domingo en un puesto propio donde se dedica a la venta confitería, lleva 20 años en esta actividad, trabaja sin horario.
Su crédito va a invertir en la compra de confites para su negocio y así crecer aun más. Su meta es tener un puesto más grande.
texts.en:
The communal bank Las Amelias is made up of seven women and one man. They live around the city of Cuenca, a city of natural beauty and with great scenery due to its rugged terrain. Four rivers pass through it, and its historic centre jealously guards the history of this beautiful city. The members are kind and gentle people who struggle every day in order to improve the stability of their households, thus moving their families forward. They still preserve the culture and traditions of their villages.

One of the members is María Mercedes, who is in her fourth loan cycle together with her friends and partners of the communal bank Las Amelias. She likes this type of loan schedule because it entails unity and solidarity between the partners. In addition to forming a group, they also form a family and always support each other.

María Mercedes is 56 years old, married, and the mother of seven children. Five of them are married and independent. One is single, works, and helps her economically, and another one is studying at university. She does not own a house so she rents one. María Mercedes works seven days a week in a stall where she sells confectionery. She has been running this business for 20 years, and works at irregular times. She will use the loan to buy confectionery for her business in order to make it grow. Her goal is to have a larger stall.

loans.use: to buy confectionery

loans.name: Renzo Samir

texts.es:
Renzo tiene 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Imperial y trabaja como obrero de campo en los fundos de su ciudad, Renzo trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y con el fruto de su humilde trabajo puede apoyar a su familia con algunos gastos del hogar, Renzo cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable.

Renzo está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales de construcción para terminar de construir un cuarto, de esta manera poder tener une mejor ambiente para vivir y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Estudiar una carrera universitaria”.
texts.en:
Renzo, 21, lives in the city of Imperial and works as a field worker in the farms of his city. Renzo works about 10 hours a day and with the fruit of his humble work, he can help his family with some of the expenses of home. Renzo believes that he is doing well in his work because he is very responsible.

Renzo is thankful for the Kiva lenders, given that thanks to the help that they have given him he will buy construction materials to finish building a room. In this manner he will be able to have a better place to live and continue fighting to make his great dream a reality: "To study a university degree."

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Nora Margarita

texts.es:
Nora es una mujer de 33 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus 5 hijos,ella es madre soltera, trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Nora no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Nora trabaja como operaria en una empresa pesquera de su ciudad, adicionalmente vende a comida y bebidas, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Nora se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará los insumos necesarios para su negocio de venta de comida como,verduras, carnes, lácteos, platos, vasos descartables y otros, así pues Nora seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Nora is a 33-year-old woman; she lives in the city of Pisco with her 5 children. She is a single mother, a worker, who dedicates all of her efforts to get her family ahead. Unfortunately, for lack of economic resources and for the need to work, Nora couldn't study a professional career. By her own initiative, Nora works as a machine operator in a fishing company in her city. Additionally, she sells food and drinks. She works every day for approximately 10 hours and believes that she is doing well because of her dedication and effort.

Nora is very thankful for the Kiva lenders, given that thanks to the help they have given her she will buy the necessary supplies for her food sale business, like vegetables, meats, dairy products, plates, disposable cups and others. In this way, Nora will continue working and pushing herself to achieve her great dream of seeing her children made into good professionals.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food sale business.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Sylvia works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling mineral water in the Philippines, and earns additional income from tricycle transportation. Sylvia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of purified drinking water to sell to customers.

Sylvia has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of purified drinking water to sell.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila works hard to support her family. Cirila is married and has a buy-and-sell coconut lumber business in the Philippines.

Cirila requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more coconut lumber to sell.

Cirila has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Cirila would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut lumber to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 43 years old and has three children. Janet is married and her children are in school.

Janet is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Janet requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and vaccines for her pigs.

Janet has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Janet would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Rider

texts.es:
Rider vive en la ciudad de aguaytia, y trabaja abonando y dando mantenimiento a  las plantas de palmas a los fundos agrícolas que hay en su ciudad, rider trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es muy responsable y trabajador.

Rider está agradecido con el apoyo que le brindan  los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a ello podrá comprar materiales para poder mejorar su vivienda, de esta manera poder mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Ser un gran agricultor”.
texts.en:
Rider lives in the city of Aguaytia, and his work entails fertilizing and carrying out the upkeep of palm trees and the agricultural plantations in the city. Rider works for around eight hours a day and he believes that he is doing well as he is very responsible and hardworking.

Rider is grateful for the help given by the Kiva loan lenders as it is thanks to the help that he will be able to buy materials to improve his home and in this manner improve his quality of life and continue forging ahead to make his greatest dream a reality: that of being a great farmer.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Elpie

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Elpie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell slippers business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from food vending.  Elpie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of slippers to sell in her buy-and-sell slippers business.

Elpie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of slippers to sell.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 32 years old and married with two children.

Maricel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks, such as canned goods, dried fish, snack foods, coffee, cooking oil, etc. to sell in her general store.

Maricel has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and earns additional income from raising pigs.

Maricel aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks, such as canned goods, dried fish, snack foods, coffee, cooking oil, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en:
Chhay just paid off the previous loan she took for farming cassavas on around one and a half hectare of land. It was a big help, and allowed her to have a stable income to provide for her family members. In the same manner, she aims to have this loan to invest in planting cassavas again in this coming season.

She will pay laborers for weeding her plantation, and buy fertilizers for her crop. HKL is a significant partner in providing her loans to further develop her farming business, as well as improving her family’s quality of life. 

Chhay will receive it as her sixth loan with HKL and her second with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay laborers for weeding her plantation, and buy fertilizers for her crop.

loans.name: Eugenio Espejo  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Eugenio Espejo está formado por 6 mujeres quienes viven en los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca esta ciudad está formada por una geografía accidentada, la cual le regala grandes paisajes, esta bañada por 4 ríos, su centro histórico fue nombrado desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad. Las socias son mujeres amables, gentiles que gozan de un gran carisma, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, la gastronomía de este sector es muy cautivadora para quienes la visitan.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Yuri, está realizando su primer crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito Eugenio Espejo, le gusta su grupo de crédito porque todas son amables y siempre se ayudan en cualquier circunstancia.
Doña Yuri tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y aun no tiene hijos, su esposo labora como empleado privado, la casa en la que vive es arrendada.
La Señora Yuri desde hace un año y medio se dedica al cuidado de niños en su casa, trabaja de lunes a viernes todo el día o hasta que sus madres los recojan. 
Su crédito va a invertir en la compra de material didáctico para los niños y así enseñarles a desarrollar su inteligente y su motricidad. Su meta es tener un restaurante ya que también le gusta mucho la cocina.
La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomola foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Eugenio Espejo communal bank is made up of 6 women who live in the vicinity of the city of Cuenca. This city is made up of hilly geography, which gives it wonderful landscapes. It has four rivers; its historic center was named a World Heritage Site in December 1999.

The members are friendly, gentle women who have great charisma and still maintain the culture and traditions of their people. The cuisine of this sector is very captivating for those who visit.

One of the members of this group is Yuri, who is taking out her first loan alongside her friends and colleagues of the Eugenio Espejo communal bank. She likes her loan group because they are all friendly and they always help in any circumstance.

Yuri, 26, is married and does not have children yet. Her husband works as a private employee. The house they live in is rented. Yuri has been making her living running a child care service out of her house for the last year and a half. She works from Monday to Friday all day or until the mothers pick up their children. 

She is going to invest her loan in the purchase of teaching materials for the children and therefore teach them to develop their intelligence and motor skills. Her goal is to have a restaurant since she likes to cook a lot.

The small photo is of a member who could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy teaching materials.

loans.name: Rhina

texts.en:
Rhina works hard to support her family. Rhina is married and has a broom-making business in the Philippines.

Rhina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials, such as bamboo, wire, rope, etc. for her business.

Rhina has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Rhina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials such as bamboo, wire, rope, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as shampoos, sugar, canned goods, milk, etc. for her general store business.

Emelia has been in this business for 36 years. Emelia earns more income from raising pigs.

Emelia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as shampoos, sugar, canned goods, milk, etc.

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is a 23-year-old, married woman with one child.

Shirly is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Specifically, she raises pigs, which she has been doing for 3 years.

Shirly is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She explains that she has borrowed five previous times from NWTF to sustain her business. She would like to build and expand her business to secure a better future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Piling Subur Group

texts.en:
Piling Subur group gets the third loan from MUK. With members of 9 people, the total loan is 22,500,000 IDR. The loan will be used to buy piglets and feed and repair cages.

Ni Ketut, as the head of the group, is using the loan to buy three superior piglets and feed. The price for superior pig species is currently very expensive; ranging from 400,000 IDR to 500,000 IDR. These pigs will be maintained for 5 months for fattening.

Ni Ketut expects that during the loan period, the pig will be able to develop properly without being attacked by disease. With this effort, she has a dream to fix her house.

loans.use: to buy three superior piglets and feed.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is married with five children, and lives in Militar, Tukuran with her family. She has been selling fruits for more than two years to earns a living. In 2009, she joined GDMPC, and her previous loan that she used to buy fruits was successfully repaid.

Recently, she borrowed a new loan to buy more grocery goods for sale. She wants to sustaine her retail store in order to earn for the family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods for sale.

loans.name: Los Comerciantes Uspantan Group

texts.es:
La señora Antonieta es soltera. Tiene 19 años de edad. Curso los 6 años de educación primaria. Se dedica a la venta de verduras. Inició este negocio con la ayuda de sus padres ya ha la fecha lleva 2 años de experiencia en el negocio.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la ampliar su capital de trabajo, comprando mas verduras para surtir el negocio. En el futuro desea que su negocio prospere y quiere tener un puesto fijo en el mercado del municipio.

Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio.
texts.en:
Antonieta is single, she is 19 years old and completed the six years of primary education. She makes her living selling vegetables. She started this business with the help of her parents, and she has already spent two years working in the business.

She heads a group and is seeking a loan to increase her working capital, buying more vegetables to stock the business. In the future, she hopes that her business will flourish and she wants to have a fixed stall at the municipality market. The other members in the group make their living in sales.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for sale.

loans.name: Judith Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora Judith está en su segundo crédito que realiza a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito Futuro para un Bienestar, le gusta mucho esta forma de créditos ya que les da la oportunidad poder platicar mas con sus amigas y vecinas, saliendo de la rutina de sus trabajos, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se encuentra formada por hermosos pasajes, su centro histórico guarda celosamente la historia de la ciudad, su gente aun mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
La Señora Judith tiene 50 años de edad, está casada pero no ha concebido hijos, su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo un camión, la casa en la que viven es propia.
Doña Judith labora a diario en su tienda de abarrotes, labora de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. 
Su crédito va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su tienda. Su sueño es conservar su salud.
texts.en:
Judith is in her second loan cycle which she is carrying out along with her friends and colleagues of the Futuro para un Bienestar (Future for well-being) communal bank. She very much likes this type of loan as it gives them the opportunity to chat more with her friends and neighbors, taking them away from the routine of their work. She lives in the city of Cuenca, this city is full of beautiful surroundings, its historic center jealously guards the city's history and its people still uphold its cities culture and traditions.

Judith is 50 years old, she is married but has not had any children. Her husband works as a driver and works driving a truck. The home in which they live is their own. Judith works daily in her grocery store, from Sunday to Sunday without fixed working hours. She will invest the loan in the purchase of supplies for her store. Her hope is to keep being in good health.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: John Cristhian

texts.es:
John tiene 22 años y trabaja como ayudante de construcción, con este trabajo puede obtener ingresos para poder solventar sus gastos de manutención y apoyar a sus padres en algunos gastos del hogar, John cree que le va bien e su trabajo porque es muy responsable y cuidadoso.

John está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo podrá realizar mejoras en la vivienda donde habita, principalmente arreglar las paredes de la cocina que no están culminadas y de esta manera evitar accidentes y mejorar su calidad de vida así podrá seguir trabajando para hacer realidad su sueño:” Estudiar una carrera universitaria y apoyar a su familia”.
texts.en:
John is 22 years old and works in construction. The job gives him an income so that he can pay for his maintenance and help his parents with some of the household expenses. John believes that it is going well at work because he is very responsible and careful.

John is grateful to the Kiva lenders because their help allows him to improve his living. First and foremost he wants to finish the kitchen walls to avoid accidents and improve his quality of life. That way, he will be able to continue working in order to achieve his dream: "Get a university degree and help his family".

loans.use: to improve his living

loans.name: Lelanie

texts.en:
Lelanie is a married woman with six children, who works hard to support her family.

She has a rag-weaving business in the Philippines. She earns additional income by buying and selling turmeric and farming vegetables.

Lelanie is seeking to borrow a loan in the amount of 11,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional supplies, such as second-hand clothing, for her rag-weaving business. She explains that she has been sustaining her business activities through four previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies, such as second-hand clothing, for her rag-weaving business

loans.name: Sari Makmur Group

texts.en:
The Sari Makmur group is requesting a loan in the same amount as their last loan. One member could not attend the meeting because of illness. Ni Ketut will use this loan to buy superior piglets and feed, and renovate the cage. She decided to choose the superior quality piglets because of the high price at which she can sell them later, and because it is easier to find a big buyer.

She hopes for her business to run smoothly and give her enough profit to support her economic needs, especially for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy superior piglets and feed, and renovate the cage.

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es:
El sr. Alcides tiene 39 años y está casado con la Sra. Liz, tienen una hija de seis años que está iniciando sus estudios primarios, y es por quien ambos están luchando y trabajando, para darle una buena educación y sea alguien de bien.
Tienen su negocio desde el año 2007, el cual es una despensa, en la que trabaja mayormente su esposa Liz, y. Alcides también se dedica a la docencia y enseña matemáticas por las tardes en colegios de la zona.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de azúcar, arroz, fideos, yerba, harina, bebidas y artículos para mercería, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas y dar a sus clientes lo que piden.
texts.en:
Mr. Alcides is 39 years old and is married with Mrs. Liz.  They have a six-year-old daughter who is starting primary school, and it is her that both are fighting and working for, to giver her a good education and so that she become a respectable individual.

They've had their business since 2007, which which is a small grocery store, where his wife Liz primarily works; Alcides also is a teacher, teaching mathematics in the afternoons in the local schools.

He is requesting this loan to invest in buying sugar, rice, noodles, herbs, noodles, flour, beverages and sewing supplies, so that they can continue selling what their clients want.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, noodles, herbs, flour, beverages and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
This is Bella. She previously accessed a loan in the amount of 25,000 PHP, which she used to buy gardening materials and supplies needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help in covering her personal (household) and business expenditures.

She is now seeking another loan, this time in the amount of 20,000 PHP. She would like to use the loan proceeds to buy gardening materials, such as wires, baskets, seeds, and fertilizers needed for her business. She feels that profits generated from her business as a result of the loan will help sustain her family's daily living expenses. She very much appreciates lenders' financial support.

Bella dreams that her trees will always bear fruit and hopes that her children will have a good future. She meets every week with her co-fellowship members to share stories about her life and her business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase various supplies (e.g., fertilizers and seeds) for her farming operations.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose vive en la ciudad de Ica, con mucho esfuerzo logro iniciar su negocio de fabricación de puertas y ventanas de aluminio, ya que el logro estudiar la carrera técnica de mecánica, Jose trabaja en su negocio alrededor de 9 horas al día y cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es cumplido con sus clientes y sobre todo realiza buenos trabajos.

Jose está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su gran ayuda podrá comprar una maquina de cerrajería, lo que le permitirá contar con la herramienta adecuada para su trabajo y atender mejor as sus clientes, así Jose seguirá trabajando y luchando por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Terminar de construir su vivienda de material noble”.
texts.en:
Jose lives in Ica and through great effort managed to start his aluminum door and window manufacturing business, since he was able to study for a mechanical technical career.  Jose works his business for about nine hours a day and he believes that things are going well for him because he is reliable to his customers and above all does quality work.

Jose is grateful to the Kiva lenders because this will allow him to buy a locksmith machine which will provide him with the proper tools to better serve his customers.  In this way, Jose will be able to make his dream a reality, “Finish building his house out of solid materials.”

loans.use: to buy a locksmith machine.

loans.name: María Trinidad

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Génesis se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 40 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 19 y 14 años de edad  los mismos que estudian en Universidad y colegio. El marido tiene un taller de pintura de carros. 
Doña María es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catalogo y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta realizando sus recorridos en sus ratos libres,  vende y cobra ya que  deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Ella empezó su negocio con unos de los créditos que recibió del banco razón por la cual está muy agradecida con la institución.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y zapatos. Lleva 12 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son tener una boutique.
texts.en: The Banco Comunal Génesis group meets every fortnight in Jipijapa.  The canton is  known as the Sultana of coffee on account of the extensive plantations which produce wonderfully flavoured coffee, its cuisine and the warmth of its inhabitants.  One of these inhabitants is 40-year-old María who lives with her partner and two children of 19 and 14, who study at university and school respectively. Her husband has a workshop where he repaints cars.  María is a housewife who sells shoes and Yanbal brand products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and ladies' accessories) by mail order to generate her own income with which she can help her husband with the household expenses.  She sells her goods by going from door to door during her free time, leaving the goods on credit and collecting payments every eight days.  She set up her business with some credit that she got from the bank and is very grateful to the institution.  She will use the loan to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and shoes.  She has been a member of the communal bank for 12 years and is pleased with it because she set up her business with one of the loans.  Her dream is to own a boutique.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and shoes

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita is 56 years old, married, and has three children. 

Bernardita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Bernardita requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional vitamins and feeds for her pigs.

Bernardita has been raising pigs for 20 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Bernardita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional vitamins and feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Romy Sarely

texts.es:
Romy es una mujer de 20 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus padres y hermanos, ella es trabajadora, entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Romy se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Contabilidad.
Por iniciativa propia, Romy trabaja como auxiliar en un estudio contable de su ciudad,ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buen desempeño.
Romy se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada compra prendas de vestir de damas para su venta, de esta manera iniciará su negocio de venta de ropa, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para logra su gran sueño de ser una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Romy is 20 years old, single, and lives in the city of Pucallpa together with her parents and siblings. She is hard-working, enthusiastic, and has a great drive to succeed. Romy is studying accounting thanks to her effort and to the help of her parents. She works on her own initiative as an accounting assistant in her city. She works every day for around 10 hours, and she believes that it is going well because of her dedication and her good performance.

Romy is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because their help allows her to buy women's clothes so that she can start a business selling clothes. She will continue working and struggling to achieve her dream of becoming a good professional.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf is a 44-year-old married man. He is the father of 3 sons and 3 daughters. 
He is a very energetic, honest, and hardworking man. He performs all his duties regarding milk, yogurt, and butter selling very well. He gets fresh milk from a wholesaler for reselling as a retailer. He uses part of the unsold milk for making yogurt, butter, and cheese and for his family usage. 

He is responsible for his children and sibling as well. His younger sister has been reaching the age of marriage. He has to arrange the dowry for her so that she can find respect in her husband’s house. He wants to grow his business to cope with the inflation and gather dowry for his sister.
 
Therefore, Ashraf requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that he can buy more milk to get more income. Ashraf hopes that this loan will bring positive changes in the lives of his beloved family members. He wants to perform his duties well regarding his sibling. 

Ashraf says thanks to Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fresh milk for reselling and producing yogurt and butter to sell.

loans.name: Baby Aluora

texts.en:
Baby Aluora is 25 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as shampoos, canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc.

Baby Aluora has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years, and earns an income from direct selling of Avon and MSE products.

Baby Aluora aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as shampoos, canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 31 years old and married.

Arlyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Arlyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Arlyn has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Arlyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mary Cris

texts.en:
Mary Cris works hard to support her child. She is married and has a business buying and selling livestock in the Philippines.

Mary Cris requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her child with bright light when they study at night.

Mary Cris is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, but is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Ashiq

texts.en:
Ashiq is a 41-year-old married man. He is an active borrower with BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan with his family. His family consists of three children and a wife. His wife is a very hardworking and responsible woman and fulfills her household duties efficiently. 

Since 1992, Ashiq has been in the business of selling milk, which is the only source of income for the family. He has two buffaloes for this work. He sells their milk door to door and in the main market. By doing so, he generates income for fulfilling his family's needs. His current net income is not enough to cope with the daily and monthly needs of his family. He has lots and lots of expenses to pay for, such as electricity bills, gas and water bills, the children’s school fees, food expenses and also the buffaloes’ upkeep and their food expenses. So, he is planning to purchase one more buffalo to increase his selling.

Currently, he is interested in purchasing one more buffalo to grow his business, but he finds it difficult due to financial constraints. Ashiq has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. He will use the loan amount to purchase a buffalo. This will not only help him to increase his milk selling, but will increase his net income and savings as well. He hopes to provide quality education for his children. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan. 

Note: In the picture, Ashiq is standing with one of his buffaloes at the farm where he keeps the buffaloes.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo in order to increase his milk sales.

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.es:
El Señor Arsenio, es carpintero, fabrica todo tipo de variedad de muebles para el hogar, comenta que se dedica a este trabajo hace más de 10 año, es muy emprendedor  y día a día lucha para salir adelante.
Vive con su esposa y un hijo menor en su propia casa que pudo tener gracias a su trabajo. El señor es muy trabajador, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación tiene  un trabajo independiente. Tiene por objetivo mantener  y fortalecer su carpintería, por esta razón ha recurrido a la fundación y agradece por la oportunidad de obtener este crédito.
Solicita este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de maderas, clavos, tornillos y demás, que va a utilizar en su taller de carpintería.
texts.en:
Arsenio is a carpenter, he builds a wide variety of furniture for the home.  He comments that he has been working in this field for more than 10 years, is very enterprising and each day he fights to get ahead.

He lives with his wife and young son in their own house that he was able to get thanks to his job.  He is very hardworking, with a lot of effort and dedication he works independently. He has a goal to maintain and strengthen his carpentry business.  For this reason, he has returned to the foundation and is thankful for the opportunity to obtain this loan.

He requests this loan to be able to invest in buying wood, nails, screws and more, that he will use in his carpentry workshop.

loans.use: To buy wood, nails, screws and more.

loans.name: Carmen Eloina

texts.es:
La Señora Carmen está realizando su primer crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito Futuro para un Bienestar, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se encuentra formada por hermosos pasajes, su centro histórico guarda celosamente la historia de la ciudad, su gente aun mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
La Señora Carmen tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 15 y 12 años que están estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad, su esposo ha migrado en busca de un mejor y futuro para su familia, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando. 
Doña Carmen desde hace 3 años labora en un bar de un colegio donde vende una gran variedad de productos, labora de lunes a viernes. 
El dinero de su crédito va a  invertir en la compra sodas, jugos, frutas, papas fritas, galletas, etc. para incrementar en su bar. Su meta es de crecer más en el negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen is making her first loan request along with her friends and colleagues from the Futuro para un Bienestar loan group. She lives in Cuenca, a city with beautiful countryside, and its historic center jealously guards the city's history. Its people still uphold the culture and traditions of its cities. 

Carmen is 36 years old, she is married and has two children aged 12 and 15 as a result of her partnership, who are studying at a secondary school in the city. Her husband moved away to seek a better future for his family. Carmen doesn't have her own home which is why she rents. 

For the last three years, Carmen has been working in a college pub where she sells a variety of products. She works from Monday to Friday. Carmen will invest the money from her loan in the purchase of fizzy drinks, fruit juices, chips, biscuits and so on to stock her bar. Her aim is to grow more in the business.

loans.use: to buy fizzy drinks, fruice juice, fruit, chips, biscuits and so on.

loans.name: Chaleta

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Chaleta works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from vending vegetables. She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for her motorcycle transport business.

Chaleta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is very thankful for the financial assistance previously extended to her, as she was able to buy the gardening materials needed in her business. Her income from business also helped in their everyday household expenses.

She would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan to buy gardening materials including wire, baskets, seed and fertilizer. Her business profits will definitely help sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Lolita hopes that her plants will grow beautiful and more customers will purchase them. As a CCT community partner, she attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she also draws strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials like wire and baskets and supplies such as seed and fertilizer needed in her business.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
This is Teodora, who previously accessed a 17,000 PHP loan to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.
 
Teodora would like to apply for another 18,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Teodora dreams that her business will expand and endure. She hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr:
Cheikh est un jeune de 25 ans, célibataire sans enfant. Détenteur d’un permis, il a décidé de se lancer dans le transport spécialement dans celui de moto taxi. Seulement, il n’a pas les moyens de s’offrir une moto-Jakarta c’est pourquoi il fait recourt a l’IMCEC pour en acheter une. Cheikh vit chez ses parents et participe a la dépense quotidienne. Les moto taxis sont un moyen de transport très utilisé dans cette partie du pays a cause de la facilité et de la rapidité. 
Cheikh est à ses débuts, mais il a comme ambition d’acheter dans l’avenir 2 autres motos pour le donner à ses frères qui sont actuellement sans travail.
texts.en:
Cheikh is a young man, 25 years old, unmarried, and without children. Possessing a permit, he decided to get started in transportation, especially in motorbike taxi services. He just lacks the means to provide services with a Jakarta motorbike. This is why he is turning toward IMCEC to purchase one. Cheikh lives with his parents and helps to cover day-to-day expenses. Moto-taxis are a highly used transportation method in this part of the country for its ease and speed. 

Cheikh is just starting off. But has the ambition to purchase two other motorbikes in the future to give to his brothers, who are currently unemployed.

loans.use: to purchase a Jakarta motorbike for his transport business

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita, a widow with a tailoring business in the Philippines, works hard to support her family. In this business for 14 years now, she is requesting a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials such as clothes, tape measures, etc.

Florita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like clothes, tape measures, etc

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna and her spouse are farmers within their village. They plant and harvest corn to sell. Aside from farming, Myrna is also selling vegetables to add to their family income. Income generated from vegetable vending goes for meals, bills at home and the education expenses of her child who is attending college.

Myrna wanted to avail a loan in order to improve the growth of her corn crop production. She will use her requested loan amount of PHP 15,000 for buying fertilizers and insecticides necessary to maintain good crop growth. In this way, she could obtain a plentiful harvest. She promises to fully pay back her loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Waliou Olakorédé

texts.fr: Waliou Olakorédé âgé de 58 ans, est marié à une marchande nommée Moudjibath. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Waliou Olakorédé a très peu fréquenté l'école. Waliou Olakorédé vit avec sa femme et ses enfants. Les charges de la maison sont supportées par le couple. Depuis quatorze ans, Waliou Olakorédé est meunier. Cette activité lui permet de faire face à ses besoins et d'assurer les charges de sa famille. Dans le but de renforcer son activité par l'achat de pièces de rechange, Waliou Olakorédé sollicite pour la sixième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Waliou Olakorédé, aged 58, is married to a merchant named Moudjibath. The couple have two children, both in school and in their care. Waliou Olakorédé has had little schooling. He lives with his wife and children. The household expenses are covered by the couple. For fourteen years, he has been making furniture. This business enables him to meet his needs and to ensure the family expenses are covered. With the goal of bolstering his business by purchasing spare parts, Waliou Olakorédé is requesting financial support from ALIDé for a sixth time. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Arame's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe de 8 femmes fait partie d'un banc villageois qui a été créé le 21 Mars 2001. Elles sont solidairement liés et exercent le petit commerce en général. Madame Arame qui est à la droite de la photo est la représentante. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre garçons et de deux filles. Elle est âgée de 48 ans. Elle s'active dans la vente de poissons séchés et d’huîtres séchées depuis plusieurs années. Elle va acheter avec le prêt 100 kg de poissons séchés et de 40 kg d’huîtres. Les bénéfices serviront a participer à la dépense quotidienne et à la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: This group of eight women is part of a 'banc villageois' that was created on March 21, 2001. The women are joined in solidarity and work in small-scale commerce in general. Ms. Arame, who is at the right in the photo, is the group's representative. She is a married mother of four boys and two girls. She is 48 years old and has been active in selling dried fish and dried oysters for several years. She is going to purchase 100 kg of dried fish and 40 kg of oysters. The profits will be used to help cover day-to-day expenses and the children's schooling costs.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish and 'yets' (dried shellfish)

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
This is Brenda. She previously accessed an 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan for her to buy more merchandise to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better.  More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 


Brenda hopes that her business will continue to flourish, and she dreams of having a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week; there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Ma. Flor

texts.en:
Ma. Flor is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle service business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle service business. Ma. Flor has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from food vending.

Ma. Flor has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura works hard to support her family. She is widow and has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 16 years now.


Laura requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like needles, thread, buttons, etc.


In the future, Laura would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like needles, thread, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 37 years old and married. Paulina has four children who are in school.

Paulina is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. Paulina requested a loan of PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy vaccines and additional cattle for her business.

Paulina has been raising cattle for seven years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Paulina would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy vaccines and additional cattle for her business

loans.name: Cheremy

texts.en:
Cheremy is 35 years old, married, and has four children. Three of her children are in school.  She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  Cheremy has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Cheremy has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Cheremy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Maribel is 39 years old and her children are in school.

Maribel has a food vending business in the Philippines. Maribel requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Maribel has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Maribel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna  is 48 years old.  She is married and has one child.  She earns a living by raising goats in the Philippines. Lorna  is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to buy an additional goat to raise.  Lorna  has been raising goats for two years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional goat to raise.

loans.name: Melicia

texts.en:
Melicia is 41 years old and has six children. Melicia is married and has one child who is still in school.  Melicia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Melicia has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Elizabeth lives with her family in the town of CPG, Bohol. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Elizabeth is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, soda, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods, flour, sugar and cooking materials. With this, she will be able to improve her stock, thus allowing her to attract more buyers in her store.

In the future, Elizabeth wants to expand her store so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family, like food and the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, soda, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods, flour, sugar and cooking materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Ishfaq

texts.en:
Mr. Ishfaq is 45 years old. He lives in Pakistan with his wife, three sons and three daughters. He is an excellent cook. He owns a food stall in the market, the only source of income for the family. He sells tasty and delicious food like fried rice, mixed vegetables, beef etc. His customers love the food he offers. His income is too low to cover their household expenses.

Presently, he is in need of purchasing oil, eggs, pulses (lentils), beef, rice and variety of vegetables for preparing food. For that reason, he has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase the needed food items for his stall.

With the profit he will first pay back the loan. Mr. Ishfaq dream is to provide the best and quality education to his children. He wants to thank all the BRAC staff for being so co-operative.

loans.use: To purchase oil, eggs, pulses (lentils), beef, rice and a variety of vegetables for preparing food

loans.name: Fridoline Norbertine

texts.fr: Fridoline est une femme de 50 ans sans enfant, ayant sa mère à sa charge. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais (tomate et légumes) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 16 ans. Il a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera augmenter son stock de cajots de tomate pour  mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fridoline is a 50-year-old woman and has no children. Supporting her mother, she is a merchant and has been selling fresh staple foods retail (tomatoes and vegetables) according to the season for sixteen years at a local market. She is very familiar with suppliers and especially her customers, whom she has acquired over the course of time, thanks to her experience in this domain. 

But she constantly finds herself short of inventory, since she is compelled to sell her entire inventory before being able to acquire more. This is due to her meager capital. She would like to increase her inventory of crates of tomatoes to do better in satisfying the constant demand from her customers and to avoid inventory shortages. She will save her profits not only to expand her business but also to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock of tomatoes

loans.name: Kutogwa Group

texts.en:
Athumani, who is in his early sixties, is married and has two children. He is also taking care of his two relative's kids. One of his children is in school. For three years now, Athumani has been running a retail shop selling items like sugar, cooking oil, maize flour, baking flour, salt, airtime and others. He works from 6am to 9pm per working day and is able to make a good profit per month. 

This is his first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this to replace the shop items sold. Athumani dreams to own a wholesale shop. He will share this loan with his loan group " KUTOGWA" which totals four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy shop items to replace those sold.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
La Sra. Feliciana tiene 56 años, tiene dos hijas mayores, ya ninguna de ellas depende de Feliciana. Ella se dedica a la compra-venta de frutas, verduras y ropa desde hace más de 12 años.
Empezó con un pequeño capital propio vendiendo frutas y verduras en su barrio en forma ambulante, después de unos años y gracias al capital ahorrado pudo fijar local comercial en su casa. Después de varios años y en vista a que le fue bien se animó a invertir más en su negocio y fue así que se acercó a la fundación paraguaya para solicitar su primer crédito, y desde hace 5 años que trabaja con la institución.
Ella hoy pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra Blusa para dama, camisas para caballero, vaquero para damas y caballeros,  frutas de estación como naranja, pomelo, y verduras como tomate, cebolla, papa, lechuga, etc., con lo que podrá seguir trabajando y luchando por crecer en su microemprendimiento.
texts.en:
Feliciana, 56, has two older daughters; neither is dependent on Feliciana. Feliciana has been buying and selling fruits, vegetables and clothing for more than 12 years.

She began with her own small equity capital selling fruits and vegetables as a street vendor in her area. After some years, and through the funds saved, she was able to get a fixed commercial place in her house. After several years, and considering it went well, she was encouraged to invest more in her business and thus she approached the Fundación Paraguaya to request her first loan. It's been 5 years she has been working with the institution.

Today she is requesting a loan in order to invest in the purchase of women's blouses, men's shirts, jeans for women and men, seasonal fruits such as oranges and grapefruit as well as vegetables like tomato, onion, potato, lettuce etc... With this loan she will be able to continue working and fighting to grow her small business.

loans.use: to purchase women's blouses, men's shirts, jeans for women and men, seasonal fruits such as oranges and grapefruit as well as vegetables like tomato, onion, potato, lettuce etc...

loans.name: Zafar Ullah

texts.en:
The person who is shown in the picture is named Zafar Ullah. He is 53 years old and lives in the populated area of Lahore, Pakistan. He has been running a small general store for 25 years, and the business is operating very well. His shop is situated under a populated area and a lot of customers are available here to offer miscellaneous general store items.
