This group is made up of five people who live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, named Emmanuela, is the woman raising her hand in the photograph. She never attended school. She's 34 years old and married to one Euloge.

The couple has four children, who are all in their care and go to school. Emmanuela lives with her husband and children. Together with her husband, she covers the household expenses.

To do so, Emmanuela has been selling food condiments at her home for seven years. She gets her supplies in a market in Benin. Eager to bolster her business, Emmanuela, together with the other members of the group, is seeking a first loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy food condiments

loans.name: Florentine's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Florentine (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 35 ans. Florentine a fréquenté l’école jusqu'au niveau primaire. Florentine est mariée à un certain Koffi. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Florentine vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. C'est pour cette raison que Florentine vend des bidons d'huile par la technique de distribution depuis dix ans. Florentine s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Florentine s’associe aux autres membres de son groupe pour solliciter un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
This group is made up of five people who live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, named Florentine, is the woman raising her hand in the photograph. She has an elementary-level education. She's 35 years old and married to one Koffi.

The couple has three children, who are all in their care. Some of them go to school. Florentine lives with her husband and children. Together with her husband, she covers the household expenses.

To do so, Florentine has been selling cans of oil through the distribution system for ten years. She gets her supplies in a market in Benin. Eager to bolster her business, Florentine, together with the other members of the group, is seeking a first loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy cans of oil

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Habiba says thanks to her previous loan from Kiva, she was able to purchase more stock for sale.

Once more, she comes to you requesting another loan of Kshs 50,000 to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, and rice for her business.

She appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, and rice for her business.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed, aged 35, is from Tombo in the western rural area of Sierra Leone. He is married with three children between the ages of four years and 12 years. He began this business because his parents did not send him to school so he was trained in running a business.  

Mohamed runs a general store: he sells drinks, cigarettes, pure water, and toothpaste. He has been running this business for eight years and works there every day, 12 hours per day. He says that the main challenge to his business is price inflation.

Mohamed has requested a loan in order to purchase items such as drinks, cigarettes, pure water, and toothpaste. The extra income from this loan will allow him to pay his installments and have his daily meal. In the future, Mohamed plans to open another shop. He appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase items such as drinks, cigarettes, pure water, and toothpaste.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim, aged 34, is from Waterloo in the western rural area of Freetown. He is married with two children aged three years and five years.  In 2008, Ibrahim established his clothing business. He began his business because he wanted to improve his family's standard of living. Ibrahim works at the business 10 hours per day and seven days per week. He says that his main business challenge is that he lacks enough capital to run his business.

Ibrahim requires a loan in order to buy men's shirts, shoes, jeans, and ladies jeans to expand his business. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to increase his business and change his family's living conditions.  In the future. Ibrahim plans to import his goods from a neighboring country. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy men's shirts, shoes, jeans, and ladies jeans to expand his business.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a widowed woman living with her eleven children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation.  Nyamvula dreams of expanding her business to be a wholesale supplier of charcoal in the village. 

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal to sell. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Babah

texts.en:
Meet 52-year-old Babah from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. He is married with 5 children.  In the past 20 years, Babah established a building materials business. He began his business, because he wants to generate a permanent source of income to support his home. He works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. He says that the main challenge to his business is lack of enough capital to run his business.

Babah requires a loan in order to buy zinc, cement, iron rods, and a head pan to expand his business. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to increase his business and pay his children's school fees.  In the future, Babah plans to renovate his business structure and open another outlet. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy zinc, cement, iron rods, and a head pan to expand his business

loans.name: Good Family Grafton Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the Good Family Grafton Group from Grafton on the outskirts of Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 1,200,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each group member. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Mariatu, aged 31, is the featured leader of this group. She is married to a businessman and they have three children. Mariatu has been a businesswoman for six years now: she sells market food – rice, palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), salt, flour, sugar, etc.  With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy  market food – rice, palm oil, salt, flour, sugar, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock

loans.name: Carino Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank, “Carino” meaning “affection, love, sweetness”, is located in the rural area of Chuicavioc in the State of Quetzaltenango in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. In this area, most are involved with agriculture and animal husbandry, particularly in breeding bulls, pigs and chickens. A smaller portion of the population is involved in commercial activities such as buying and selling vegetables. Others are engaged in the weaving industry.

Maria Beatriz is the 31-year-old mother of five children. She, along with 12 other women, meet each month with their Trust Bank and a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer. During their meetings, they may make payments on their loans and participate in educational training on subjects like business administration and indebtedness, money management and savings, women’s health and family planning as well as self-esteem.

Maria Beatriz is an enterprizing merchant who purchases and sells potatoes on a daily basis. In the afternoon, she cleans houses. She is motivated to work hard because she wants her children to be successful in the future. She realizes that the key to success is education. Four of her children are in elementary school and the fifth one is in kindergarten. Currently, Maria Beatriz is starting her third loan cycle with Friendship Bridge. Her loan of $385 will help to launch her newest business endeavor which will be a “tortilleria” where she will make and sell tortillas. She plans to buy corn in bulk. Maria Beatriz looks forward to increased profits so that she will be able to purchase better food which in turn will lead to better health for her family.

The Trust Bank, “Carino”, appreciates the support and confidence of Kiva investors throughout the world. Because of these small loans, these women have a way to generate income, working with their husbands to support their families. For  women who are single, divorced or widowed, the loans are essential. It is a true win-win situation which improves the lives of families and the well-being of their community.

loans.use: to buy corn to make tortillas for sale

loans.name: Las Marias De San Jose Chiriju Group

texts.en:
Rosa is a 51-year-old lady who is married and has 5 children (oldest 29 and youngest 13). Four of them are currently in school. Rosa and her family live in rural Llanos del Pinal, Quetzaltenango in the western highlands of Guatemala, where many people are engaged in activities like agriculture and animal husbandry. Many women are also seamstresses. Rosa belongs to the community bank called CIELO (Heaven), along with 13 other women, who seek to develop themselves and their families. Besides agriculture, these ladies are also dedicated to sewing, growing and selling flowers, buying and selling all kinds of vegetables, breeding animals, etc.

Rosa and her family have been engaged in the farming industry for several years.  She decided to approach Friendship Bridge for a loan to increase the amount of land available for cultivation. Currently, she is starting her 6th loan cycle; Rosa is so excited to request a loan of 512 USD, which she’ll use to buy seeds, fertilizer, and manure for a crop of 10 strings. Among the products they grow there are: onions, lettuce, carrots, and broccoli. Rosa and her family sell the vegetables to wholesalers in a large market located about 1 hour from their land. 

Rosa's great desire is that her children could stay in school, so their future can be better than hers. She says that it's hard not knowing how to write in Spanish, even though she understands and speaks some Spanish. Currently two of her children are in high school on weekends so they can support the family during the week in the field. Also her two youngest children are in elementary school daily.

Rosa and the other women of the trust bank CIELO are grateful for the support and trust of KIVA investors. With the working capital they give, these ladies can make their small businesses grow and/or maintain the same level. Their businesses are sources of income for them and their families.

loans.use: To buy strawberries seeds, and to buy chickens.

loans.name: Alimamy

texts.en:
Alimamy, in his late forties, is from Tombo in the western rural area of Freetown. He is married with two children aged four years and seven years. In 2008, Alimamy established his clothing business because, after he had completed sixth form, his family could not afford to pay his college fees, so he raised the money to start up his own business: before he was a security guard. He works in the business 10 hours per day and seven days per week. He says that his main business challenge is lack of enough capital to run his business.

Alimamy requires a loan in order to buy men's shirts, shoes, jeans, and ladies jeans to expand his business. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to increase his business and repay his loan.  In the future, Alimamy plans to build his own business structure and open another outlet. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy men's shirts, shoes, jeans, and ladies jeans to expand his business.

loans.name: Norberto

texts.es: El señor Norberto tiene la edad de 52 años practicamnete toda su vida a trabajado la tierra desde muy pequeño su papa le enseño a cosechar y cultivar Piña y Pitahaya, el credito lo solicita para la compra de insumos como triple, urea, completo, fertilizantes para darle asi mantenimiento a su cosecha de piña y aprovechar la lluvia para que lave las plagas y demas insectos que quieran poderarse de la siembra, agradece a Kiva y Afodenic por confiar nuevamente en el.
texts.en:
Norberto is 52 years old. He has worked in the field for all of his live. When he was very young, his father already taught him to harvest and cultivate pineapple and pitahaya. 

He asks for a loan to buy supplies such as Triple, urea and Completo fertilizers to maintain his pineapple crop and to make use of the rain to wash away pests and other insects which infest his cultivated land.

He thanks Kiva and Afodenic for placing trust in him again.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Afiavi Sara's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Afiavi Sara (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 53 ans. Afiavi Sara n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Afiavi Sara est mariée à un certain Félix. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et un reste à leur charge. Afiavi Sara vit avec ses enfants. Les charges de ménage sont supportées par Afiavi Sara et son mari. C'est pour cette raison que dame Afiavi Sara vend des condiments dans sa région depuis vingt cinq ans. Afiavi Sara s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Afiavi Sara s’associe aux autres membres de son groupe pour solliciter un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: This group is made up of 3 people who live in the same district. The group's representative, Afiavi Sara (the one with her hand raised in the picture), is 53 years old. Afiavi Sara did not go to school. Afiavi Sara is married to Félix. The couple have 3 children, some of whom go to school and still live with them. Afiavi Sara lives with her children. The household expenses are covered by Afiavi Sara and her husband. In order to be able to do this, Afiavi Sara has been selling condiments in her area for 25 years. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. Afiavi Sara is joining with the other members of her group to request a first loan from ALIDé, with a view to strengthening her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Gladys Elena

texts.es: Gladys, a sus 47 años de edad, es madre de un hijo y cabeza de hogar desde el lamentable fallecimiento de su esposo. Durante su vida productiva trabajó como vendedora de mercancía alrededor de 7 años pero, hace 3 años realizó estudios de producción de blanqueador y jabones líquidos y luego de culminar el curso de capacitación, ella decidió iniciar su propio negocio, una microempresa dedicada a la fabricación y comercialización de blanqueador y jabón líquido, ya lleva 3 años de funcionamiento, en los que la ha ido organizando debidamente y se está dando a conocer en el sector. Su empuje, dedicación y espíritu emprendedor le han permitido lograr los objetivos que se propone, es por ello que se motiva a solicitar el apoyo del crédito, con el dinero comprará los insumos al por mayor (hopoclorito, glicerina, colágeno, entre otros), así tendrá disponibilidad de materia prima necesaria para satisfacer la demanda del producto y así poder aumentar la producción, lo que para ella significa tener un incremento notable en los ingresos que recibe. Gladys desea seguir trabajando con constancia y empeño para seguir avanzando, ampliar su mercado y así garantizar a su hijo la oportunidad de tener una buena educación y bienestar.
texts.en:
Gladys, 47, has a son and is the head of the household since her husband died. While employed, she worked selling merchandise for seven years. Three years ago, she took a course where she learned to make bleach and liquid soaps and decided to start her own business when she finished it. She opened a micro company producing and selling bleach and liquid soap.

During these three years, she has put everything in order and has made herself known in the sector. Her persistence, dedication and entrepreneurial spirit are the reason why she has reached the goals she has set. This is why she wants to request a loan to buy supplies in bulk (hypochlorite, glycerin, collagen, etc.) in order to have the necessary raw materials to satisfy her orders and expand her production activities. This will in turn result in an increase in her income.

Gladys would like to continue working hard in order to progress, expand her business to other markets and that way make sure her son has the opportunity to receive a good education and live a good life.

loans.use: to buy supplies in bulk for her bleach and soaps business: hypochlorite, glycerin, collagen, etc.

loans.name: Abadahemana Group

texts.fr:
Didace fait partie du groupe  Abadahemana et  habite à Bujumbura. Il  a 34 ans et est marié à Niyonsenga. Une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants qui étudient. 

Il fait le commerce de restaurant (haricot, riz, patate douce,..) depuis 3 mois. 

Il est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de produits vivriers (haricot, riz, patate douce,..)  à revendre  cuits, dans son restaurant, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait que  ses enfants étudient.
texts.en: Didace is a member of the Abadahemana group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 34 years old and married to Niyonsenga, a farmer. The couple have 4 children together and the children all go to school. Didace has been running a restaurant selling meals prepared with food like beans, rice and sweet potatoes for 3 months. This is his 3rd loan from Turame. His Kiva-sponsored loan will increase his working capital and allow him to buy a large amount of food items like beans, rice and sweet potatoes to prepared and resell in his restaurant, in order to earn more money. In the coming years, he would like to see his children get an education.

loans.use: to buy a lot of food products (beans, rice, sweet potatoes, etc.) to prepare in his restaurant.

loans.name: Ba-Tiwomia Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the Ba-Tiwomia group from Waterloo, a town in western Sierra Leone, near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. They are petty-businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to apply for a loan of 800,000.00 SLL for each woman in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their respective businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

The featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Jestina. Jestina was born in the village of Buedu in eastern Sierra Leone 46 years ago. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a social worker, and 3 of her children are attending secondary while 1 is attending a tertiary institution. Jestina has been selling palm-oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), onions, margi, salt, pepper, and other items. for 5 years now. She has requested this loan in order to expand her business by buying palm-oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, and other items in bulk to add to her current intentory.

loans.use: to buy palm-oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, and other items in bulk to add to her current ones

loans.name: La Vigueur 2.1 Group

texts.en: Arcaduis is one of the members of the group La Vigueur 2.1, which consists of him and five other micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. Arcaduis is married with two children and has been working with HOPE Congo for the last four loan cycles. He will use his loan to purchase drinks for his business which he has been operating for the past five years. Despite having difficulty finding certain beverages at certain times of the year, Arcaduis will use his loan and his financial aptitude to continue to grow his business. With this growth in his business, he hopes to invest in a new house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase drinks to increase his stock.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Meet Mariatu, She is a 43-year-old from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 4 children between the ages of 4 and 24 years old. Three of her children are currently attending school. For the past 16 years, Mariatu has operated a food container business within a busy market area.  She began this business because she went into an early marriage and she was maltreated, so she decided to empower herself with business. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to his business is that during rainy season sales are very slow.

Mariatu requires a loan in order to purchase more rubber bowls, buckets and baskets to resell. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and start a savings account. In the future, Mariatu plans to expand her business more than even. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more rubber bowls, buckets and baskets to resell.

loans.name: Mubigazi Group

texts.fr:
Célestin fait partie du groupe  Mubigazi et  habite à Bubanza. Il  a 30 ans et est marié à Esperance. Une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 1 à 7 ans, dont 1 étudie.
Il  a sous sa charge 4 élèves membres de sa famille élargie.

Il fait le commerce de  boutique (piles, sucre, bougies, savons…)  depuis 5 ans. 

C’est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’articles (piles,sucre, bougies, savons…)   à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait importer ses produits de l’Ouganda et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en: Célestin is a member of the Mubigazi group and lives in Bubanza. He is 30 years old and married to Esperance, a farmer. The couple have 4 children together, aged between 1 and 7, one of whom attends school. He is raising 4 other members (also students) of his extended family. He has been running a shop (selling items like batteries, sugar, candles and soap) for 5 years. This is his first loan from Turame. His Kiva-sponsored loan will increase his working capital and allow him to buy a lot of items for resale in his shop (batteries, sugar, candles, soap, etc.), so that he can earn more money. In the coming years, he would like to start importing his products from Uganda and to see his children get an education.

loans.use: to buy a lot of items like batteries, sugar, candles and soap for resale.

loans.name: Las Colmenas Group

texts.en:
Yanna is the group coordinator of Las Colmenas. Her group is located in the Samana province of the Dominican Republic and is composed of 15 micro-entrepreuners. She lives in a simple home structure with her two children and her long-term partner. Yanna said her most difficult challenges have been to complete her university studies and raise and educate her children. 

This is Yanna's tenth loan with Esperanza. She started her business with the first loan she received from Esperanza International almost six years ago. She plans to use this loan to purchase different pairs of shoes, sandals and tennis shoes for men, women and kids. She also plans to invest in miscellaneous products

She always uses her business profits to reinvest in her business but is also saving because her future plans are to improve her family's living conditions, have enough money to provide a good education for her children, and send the children to university. She hopes to be able to save enough money to continue improving her family's lives and to make one of her dreams come true; the dream of having a successful business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase shoes, sandals, sport shoes, etc

loans.name: Salomon 2 Group

texts.en:
Francisca is the coordinator of her group named Salomon 2 from the city of Samana's Peninsula, a lush, rugged area with a nascent tourism industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.

Francisca is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and growing her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business, a little store where she sells groceries. With the loan, she will purchase rice, beans, meat, canned food, flour, sugar, and other goods. She will use the profits to provide for her family. She also plans to save to build a local business next to her house, where she can run her grocery store. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, meat, canned food, flour, sugar, and other goods.

loans.name: Jehova Jireh 1 Group

texts.en:
Consuelo is a single mother. She lives in her home built with a simple structure, like others in her community, with two of her three children in the city of La Romana in one of the rural areas that are called bateys. Most bateys are located in a sugarcane field and were built for the sugarcane industry workers.

Consuelo says her most favorites things to do are to take her children to eat ice cream and to the park. Her most important challenge is to continue growing in her life and business. Three years ago Consuelo started her clothing sales business with the money she received when she stopped working in a company.

Consuelo is receiving her fifth loan from Esperanza International and will invest this capital into her clothing sales business; this loan will be invested to buy new clothes and pants by the dozen. With her business profits, she will reinvest in her business. She dreams of having a nail and beauty salon in a better location.

Consuelo and her group are going to devote themselves to various areas of work such as clothes, cosmetics, shoes, beauty salons, grocery stores, etc. Thanks for supporting this group of entrepreneurs!

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Tunashukuru Group

texts.fr: La cliente Budandi est une trésorière du collectif de crédit « Tunashukuru», senior entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 45 ans  et mère de 8 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un ouvrier dans une compagnie d’aviation civile. La cliente est une vendeuse des souliers.  Elle installe  ses articles à un point de vente animé et parfois à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le fonds additionnels du prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il ya 27 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité.  Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 100 paires de souliers. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser ses enfants, étendre son projet de commerce. La vente en crédit et les pertes de change sont de défis pour le développement de son activité. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre a l’Est du pays.
texts.en: Budandi, the customer, is the treasurer of the loan association "Tunashukuru". She is a senior and experienced entrepreneur, a dynamic woman who is 45 years old and the mother of 8 children who all attend school. Her spouse is a worker at a civil aviation company. Budandi sells shoes. She displays her wares in a busy sales outlet and, occasionally, at home. She started her business with funds she received from her husband. Later on, she benefited from extra funds in the form of loans from the MFI Hekima. She has been running her business for 27 years. This new loan will be used to buy 100 pairs of shoes. She would like to make sure her children get an education, and to expand her business. The main challenge to the development of her business are the sales of goods on credit and the losses she makes on the exchange rate. Finally, she would like to strongly thank Hekima for its help in making non-bankable female entrepreneurs self-sufficient, especially at this critical time with the war going on in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 100 pairs of shoes.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet Fatmata.  She is in her early 40's and is from Waterloo, an eastern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with three children.  

In 2003, Fatmata established a food stuff business within the Waterloo community. She began this business because she wanted to create a permanent source of income to support her children; she works at the business from 7:00 am until 7:00 pm, 6 days per week. She says the main challenge to this business is price inflation of goods and storage facilities.

Fatmata requires a loan to purchase more cooking oil, flour, and seasonings for cooking. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to become more successful, and to pay her children's school fees. 

In the future, Fatmata plans to build her own shop, and become a distributor of food stuff. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, flour, and seasonings for cooking.

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Meet Ramatu. She is 50, and from Jui, in the eastern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with three children between the ages of 10 and 30. Two of her children are currently attending school. 

In 1987, Ramatu established a general merchandise business within a busy market area.   She began her business because she wanted to change her status of living; she works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says the main challenge to this business is insufficient financing to expand.

Ramatu requires a loan to purchase biscuits, sugar, cigarettes, soap, and drinks to sell. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and repay her loan. 

In the future, Ramatu plans to open another outlet. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase biscuits, sugar, cigarettes, soap, and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel vive en la ciudad de imperial, es un hombre muy trabajador y sobre todo muy entusiasta, para poder obtener ingresos para poder sacar adelante a su familia logro iniciar su pequeño negocio de crianza y venta de cuyes, cuyo trabajo le gusta mucho y el cree que es por ello que le va bien por su dedicación y amabilidad con los clientes.

Miguel está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá materiales para la construcción de 5 jaulas, ya que ha aumentado el número de animales que cría y es necesario criarlos en un ambiente cómodo, de esta manera su negocio seguirá mejorando y seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una gran granja y construir su vivienda de material noble”.
texts.en:
Miguel lives in the city of Imperial. He is a hardworking man and above all, is very enthusiastic. To be able to earn an income to get his family ahead, he started his small business of raising and selling guinea pigs. He likes the work a lot and believes that it has gone well because of his dedication and friendliness with customers. 

Miguel is thankful for the Kiva lenders because with their help, he will be able to buy the materials to make 5 cages. He has increased the number of animals he is raising, and it’s important to raise them in a comfortable environment. This way his business will continue to improve and he will continue fighting to make his greatest dream a reality, to have a big farm and construct his home out of quality materials.

loans.use: construct cages

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr: Ayawa est une femme de 42 ans mariée à un instituteur à Baguida. Elle a 5 enfants tous scolarisés dont l’ainé a 21ans et le dernier a 7ans. Elle est revendeuse et a démarré son activité depuis 2001. Elle revend des produits cosmétiques à toutes personnes. Elle sollicite son premier prêt auprès de WAGES pour l’achat et la vente des produits cosmétiques. Elle espère ouvrir une boutique et avoir une bonne condition de vie.
texts.en: Ayawa is a 42-year-old woman who is married to a teacher and lives in Baguida. She has 5 children who all attend school. The eldest is 21 years old and the youngest, 7. She is a reseller and started her business in 2001. She sells beauty products to all types of people. She is requesting her first loan from WAGES in order to buy and then resell beauty products. She hopes to be able to open a shop and to enjoy decent living conditions.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Koudjo

texts.fr: Koudjo est un homme de 26ans marié avec une couturière. Il a 2enfants de 3ans et 1an. Il est infirmier dans une infirmerie et s’occupe de tous patients dans un cabinet médical. Il exerce depuis 2006 et emploi 4 employés. Il demande son premier prêt auprès de WAGES pour acheter et vendre des médicaments puis reépargner. Il compte aussi augmenter la taille du cabinet et améliorer la condition de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Koudjo is a 26-year-old man who is married to a seamstress. He has 2 children aged 3 and 1. He is a nurse in an infirmary and treats of all sorts of patients in a doctor's office. He has been doing this since 2006 and employs 4 workers. He is requesting his first loan from WAGES in order to buy and resell medicine, and then increase his savings. He also plans to increase the size of his office and to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy medicine.

loans.name: Mamusu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 30-year-old Mamusu from Waterloo's eastern area in Freetown. She is married with one child, age 8. She started this business because she needed to create a permanent source of income to support the home.  

Mamusu runs a retail shop; she sells toothpaste, soap, drinks, and hair relaxing products; she has been running this business since 2007. She works at the business seven days a week and twelve hours a day.  Mamusu says that the main challenges to her business are the difficulty in transporting her goods from the city to her business place, and price inflation.

Mamusu has requested a loan to purchase items including toothpaste, soap, drinks, and hair relaxer. The extra income from this loan will allow her to buy a plot of land and renovate her house. 

In the future, she plans to build a permanent business location. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase items including toothpaste, soap, drinks, and hair relaxer

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 26 years old and she lives in West Point; she is single and she is a third grade dropout. 

She has been selling cold water along the road side for the past two years. She enjoys her business because she has many costumers. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase cold water by the sack for her business. 

Janet hopes to have her own  house.

loans.use: to purchase cold water by the sack for her business.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen de 59 años de edad, habita en el sur occidente de la ciudad, lugar donde hace 11 años empezó su actividad comercial, después de consultar con su esposo y su hija, la formula para salir adelante, generando ingresos con una actividad alternativa de la familia. 
Inicialmente empezaron a comercializar con calzado y entre su clientela surgió la necesidad de ofrecer productos de belleza, razón por la cual empezó a vender maquillaje, productos capilares a los que  gradualmente, adicionó accesorios para damas, productos de aseo personal, distribuidos directamente entre su clientela. 
Sus ventas las hace de contado y a crédito, de  lunes a domingos, en un horario que inicia  desde las 10 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, ofreciendo estas mercancías, entre sus vecinos del barrio y de los sectores aledaños, mientras sus compras las realiza de contado,  en el centro de la ciudad. 
Carmen ha recibido cuatro financiamientos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con los que ha logrado mejorar su negocio, comprando muchos más artículos y vitrinas donde organizarlos. Su meta es tener un almacén, para ampliar sus posibilidades de ingresos, con el fin de hacer que sus hijos logren un mayor bienestar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual planea impactar las ventas del último trimestre del año, temporada en la cual las ventas impactan positivamente sus ingresos. Con su credikiva comprará calzado, ropa, accesorios femeninos, mercancías de mayor rotación en esta época hermosa de navidad y de año nuevo, en la cual las personas, quieren vestir elegantes para esperar en unidad familiar las fiestas que los integran entre  abrazos, música y sonrisas.
texts.en:
Carmen is 59 years old. She lives in the south west of the city. After consulting with her husband and her daughter which would be the best way to succeed, she started her business 11 years ago. Now she is generating income with an activity which is new in her family. 

Initially, she started to sell footwear and then her clients also needed beauty products. This is why she started selling makeup and hair products, to which she gradually added women’s accessories and also personal grooming products.

She sells directly to her customers, for cash or on credit, Monday to Sunday between 10 a.m. and 7 p.m. She offers her goods to the residents in her neighborhood and in the surrounding areas. She makes her purchases in the city and pays in cash. 

Carmen has received four loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she managed improve her business by buying many additional products and showcases to organize them. It is her goal to have a store to expand her business opportunities and by this to provide for a better life for her children. She is now asking for a Kiva loan which she will use to invest in the last quarter of the year, as in this season she makes much profit with her sales. With the Kiva loan she will buy footwear, apparel and women’s accessories – products which have a high turnover in this beautiful time of Christmas and New Year, when people want to dress smart to await the festivities with their families with hugs, music and smiles.

loans.use: to buy footwear, apparel, women's accessories.

loans.name: Vilma Leticia

texts.en:
Vilma is an artisan who specializes in traditional Guatemalan dance masks. She would like to invest in buying wood and paint for production.

Vilma has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is her story:

"My grandfather promoted Guatemala's traditional dances, and he inspired me to immerse myself more and more in their history, meaning and relevance. Today, my husband works with me in our little workshop. We have a few assistants who help us. All our designs are carved by hand, requiring much effort and dedication, but the love we have for our work gives us the motivation we need to go on."

A message from Vilma: "Thank you for your trust and confidence in me -- you encourage me to keep on working. Your microcredit motivates me to work harder. I wish you all the best in your own endeavors for I know that your good actions will be rewarded. Many thanks!"

loans.use: to invest in wood and paint for production

loans.name: San Francisco De Asis 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Yefer is the coordinator of his group, San Francisco de Asis 1 & 2. This group is located in a rural area of Santiago. He makes his home there in a simple structure with his long-term partner and one of his two children. He says his dream is to have his own house, and a big tailoring business.

Yefer is excited to be taking his third loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid his previous loans and grown his business. He has had his business for almost three years, starting with the money he received after he quickly completed a job. 

Yefer plans to use this loan to invest in his business by buying different fabrics, threads, and accessories. He will also use future profits to reinvest in his business to produce clothes, bed clothes, and many other products. He thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: To buy fabric and other sewing accessories

loans.name: Napoleon

texts.en:
Napoleon is a farmer. He is 53 years old and married, with three children. Two of his children are now employed, and one is still studying.

Napoleon makes his living in planting and harvesting corn to sell. While he is busy in cultivating his corn farm land, his wife also raises hogs for additional income. 

Napoleon would like to improve his harvest, but he has insufficient fund now.  That is why he is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000, which he will use in buying fertilizer, pesticides and insecticides use in farming.

This additional capital will help him to nourish his crops and obtain better yields someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and insecticides use in farming

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.fr: Yaovi est un homme de 35ans marié à une revendeuse et a 4 enfants. Le premier a 14ans et le dernier 2ans, deux sont scolarisés. Il est frigoriste dans un atelier et sert tous clients, il exerce depuis 2006 et sollicite un second prêt auprès de WAGES pour l’achat de matériels pour le froid auto. Il compte augmenter la taille de son activité et assurer l’éducation des enfants.
texts.en: Yaovi is a 35-year-old man who is married to a reseller and has 4 children. The eldest is 14 years old and the youngest, 2. Two of his children attend school. Yaovi is a refrigeration engineer who works in a workshop and serves all types of customers. He has been doing this since 2006 and is requesting a second loan from WAGES in order to buy materials for car air conditioning systems. He plans to increase the size of his business and to make sure his children get an education.

loans.use: to buy materials for car air conditioning systems.

loans.name: Andrei

texts.ru:
Андрей занимается свадебным бизнесом. Среди услуг, которые он предоставляет: предоставление свадебного транспортного кортежа, оформление залов для свадеб, организация фуршетных столов и украшение церквей, где проходят бракосочетания. Так как бизнес Андрей не имеет конкурентов в Дрогобыче, у него всегда много заказов и от клиентов нет отбоя. И хотя Андрей много и усердно трудится, он никак не может скопить крупной суммы, которая ему и его семье уже так давно необходима на утепление дома.
Андрею для ремонта нужна сумма в 24 000 гривен для того, чтобы утеплить холодный дом, в котором зимой просто невыносимо понижается температура. Из-за того, что стены тонкие и не держат тепло внутри помещения, согреться трудно, маленькая 3-летняя дочка часто простывает. Используя финансовые средства, полученные от Кива, Андрей надеется обложить дом пенопластом, который является достаточно неплохой и самой доступной формой утеплителя жилых помещений. Андрей очень любит свою семьи, всегда старается для нее, создавая уют и обеспечивая достаток для своих родных.
texts.en:
Andrei is in the wedding business. Among the services he offers are transportation for the wedding cortege, setting up halls, organizing buffets and decorating churches where the wedding ceremony is held. Since Andrei’s business has no competition in Drogobych, he has many orders and the demand is relentless. Although Andrei is very busy and works very hard, he cannot save up enough money to keep his house warm, which he and his family have long needed.

To do the repairs, Andrei needs 20,000 hriven to insulate the house, where the temperature gets unbearably low during the winter. Because the walls are thin and don’t hold the heat well, it’s difficult to heat the house, and his little 3 year-old daughter often gets really cold. With a loan from Kiva, Andrei hopes to install plastic foam, which is reasonably effective and the most obtainable insulating material. Andre loves his family very much and is always trying to keep them comfortable and ensure a decent life for his loved ones.

loans.use: to insulate the house

loans.name: Santos  Edith

texts.es:
La señora Santos es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a  sus  hijos y esposo. Su negocio es la venta de ropa desde hace varios años.
Doña Santos su negocio lo realiza en su casa de habitación y lugares cercanos a su municipio. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de más ropa como pantalones, vestidos, faldas, pantalones, camisas y blusas para seguir con su negocio ya que tiene bastantes clientes y en este momento no cuenta con los recursos necesarios para surtir su negocio.
Doña Santos con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y que esto le sirva de mucho espera que con esta inversión mejore su calidad de vida y la de su familia debido a que tendrá más ingresos en su hogar. 
Su sueño es en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que su hijos tenga los estudios necesarios.


Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre del  2013
texts.en:
Santos is a hardworking, responsible woman who lives in a community in the south of Honduras next to her children and husband. For several years, her business has been selling clothes. She runs her business from her home, and from places that are close to her town. She needs the loan to purchase more clothes such as pants, dresses, skirts, shirts, and blouses to continue with her business since she has many customers and right now she does not have the necessary resources to stock her business. 
 
Santos hopes that with the loan her sales will increase and that it will serve her well. She hopes that with this investment, she can improve her quality of life and that of her family since she will have more income for her home. 

Her short term dreams are to make her business grow and with this, continue supporting her family and provide her children with the necessary studies. 

Choluteca, Honduras – September 2013

loans.use: purchase pants, dresses, skirts, shirts, and blouses for her business

loans.name: Ameyo

texts.fr: Ameyo est une femme mariée de 33ans à un chauffeur. Elle a 3 enfants ; le premier a 13ans et le dernier 5ans, deux sont scolarisés. Elle exerce depuis 2010.  Elle achète et revend des produits d’alimentation générale à tous à la maison. Elle sollicite son deuxième prêt auprès de WAGES pour toujours acheter et revendre des produits d’alimentation générale puis réinvestir dans l’activité. Elle compte agrandir son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie pour sa famille.
texts.en: Ameyo is a 33-year-old woman who is married to a driver. She has 3 children. The eldest is 13 years old and the youngest, 5. Two of her children attend school. Ameyo has been a retailer since 2010. She buys grocery products and then resells them to all types of customers from her home. She is requesting her second loan from WAGES so that she is able to continue buying and reselling food products, and can then reinvest in her business. She plans to expand her business and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Rovelson

texts.en:
Rovelson is 48 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. He cultivates rice and raises hogs in Cordon. His wife is a teacher within their locality.

Rovelson is requesting a loan for 15,000 PHP, which he will use to buy hog feed, one piglet, and vitamins for his hogs. He would like to keep his livestock business profitable but he had insufficient funds. He knows that through supplying his hogs with nutritious hog feed he will keep them healthy upon reaching their optimum growth. With this loan, Rovelson hopes to sustain his family welfare and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed, one piglet, and vitamins

loans.name: Nurmahmad

texts.ru:
Нурмахмаду 32 года. Он женат на швеи. У них двое девочек. Им по 7 и 4 года. Они живут в районе Яван. Сам Нурмахмад строитель. Он берет заказы на строительство и ремонты. Но из-за того что его работа является сезонной, Нурмахмад занимается дополнительно растениеводством. Работу на земле он взял на свои плечи 3 года назад. Он на своем земельном участке выращивает овощи, он хочет, чтобы его дети питались здоровой пищей. 
Сейчас Нурмахмад активно готовится к осеннему посеву. Еще не поздно для посева, потому что в Таджикистане зима приходит очень поздно, а осени почти незаметно. Нурмахмаду нужно приобрести минеральных удобрений, горючей смеси и семян. Чтобы приобрести их, он запрашивает кредит.
texts.en: Nurmahmad is 32, and is married to a seamstress. They have two daughters, 7 and 4, and live in Yavan.  Nurmahmad is a builder. He does customer building and repairs. But because his business is seasonal, he also grows crops. He took on this agricultural works three years ago. He grows vegetables on his own plot of land so that his children can have nutritious food to eat. Right now Nurmahmad is getting ready for the autumn planting. There is still time to plant, for the Tadjik winter comes very late, and autumn is almost imperceptible. Nurmahmad needs to buy fertilizer, fuel, and seed, and he is seeking a loan to purchase them.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, fuel, and seed

loans.name: Sandy

texts.es:
La joven Sandy es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de ropa clasificada, desde hace 1 año.
Sandy tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación en un municipio de Choluteca y también sale a vender a diversos lugares aledaños. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de blusas, faldas, pantalones, camisetas, calzonetas, etc. para seguir realizando su trabajo, el cual le brinda una gran parte de sus ingresos. 
Sandy con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y que le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con la mercadería necesaria para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por sus clientes y gracias a esto poder mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar.
Sandy su sueño es en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hermanos.



Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre del  2013
texts.en:
Young Sandy is very hard-working and responsible.  She lives with her family in a community in the south of Honduras and has had a business selling clothes for one year.

Sandy runs the business out of her home in the municapality of Choluteca.  She also goes out to sell in neighbouring areas.  Sany needs this loan to buy blouses, skirts, trousers, shirts, underwear, and more, in order to continue working.  Her work provides her with an income.

Sandy hopes that, with this loan, her sales will increase.  She hopes the loan will be of great help as she does not currently have the necessary merchandise to fulfill her customers' orders.  Thanks to this loan Sandy will be able to improver her and her family's quality of life, with an increased income in the home.  Sandy's short-term dream is to expand her business and to continue supporting her family and siblings.

Choluteca, Honduras, September 2013

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, trousers, shirts, underwear, and more, for her business.

loans.name: Norma Azucena

texts.es:
La señora Norma es una persona muy trabajadora, humilde y responsable, vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras con su hija. Su negocio es la venta de lociones y joyas de plata, desde hace 14 años.
Doña Norma vende desde su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive. Necesita el préstamo para la compra anillos, pulseras, cadenas, perfumes y lociones para seguir realizando su trabajo, el cual le brinda una gran parte de sus ingresos. 
Doña Norma con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y que éste le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos necesarios para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por sus clientes a diario y gracias a esto poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Doña Norma espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que su hija tenga los estudios necesarios, para que pueda tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre del  2013
texts.en:
Norma is very hard-working, humble and responsible.  She lives with her daughter in a community in the south of Honduras.  Norma has had a business selling lotions and silver jewelerry for 14 years.

Norma sells out of her home in the town where she lives.  She needs this loan to buy rings, bracelets, chains, perfumes, and lotions, in order to continue working.  This job provides Norma with a large part of her income.

Norma hopes that, with this loan, her sales will increase.  She hopes that this loan will be of great help to her as she does not have the necessary products to fulfill her customers' daily orders.  Thanks to this loan Norma will be able to improve her family's quality of life.

Norma hopes that, in the short-term, her business will exapnd.  She will then be able to continue to support her family and providing her daughter with an education so that she can have better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras, September 2013

loans.use: to buy rings, bracelets, chains, perfumes, and lotions, for her business.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
As the married parent of three children, Mary Joy works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from pig fattening.  Mary Joy is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like spices, vegetables, meat, etc., for her food-vending business.

Mary Joy has sustained her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like spices, vegetables, meat, etc.

loans.name: Miraluna

texts.en:
Miraluna is 44 years old and married with six children.

Miraluna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines Pesos) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Miraluna has borrowed and repaid thirty-four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seventeen years and also earns an income from selling dried fish.

Miraluna aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Lydia requested a 15,000 loan PHP (Philippines Pesos) through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap,  noodles, milk, etc.

Lydia has been in this business for forty-five years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap,  noodles, milk, etc

loans.name: Alberto Manuel

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Alberto con sus negocios de peluquería y video-juegos, éste último negocio  se lo debe a su credikiva que la impulsó y hoy los niños del barrio son sus principales clientes y tienen oportunidad de jugar desde equipos con los que no cuentan. En la actualidad Alberto está siendo más reconocido, y por eso dice a los financiadores de Kiva “Gracias por su colaboración económica a nuestras  actividades. En la actualidad, Alberto, tiene planes de continuar invirtiendo en el crecimiento de su negocio, y por eso ha acudido nuevamente a Kiva para acceder a un nuevo financiamiento, mediante el cual comprará un play statión mas moderno, pues la modernidad tecnológica al alcance de los jóvenes, es lo que atrae a este segmento de mercado, que se perfilan como sus mejores clientes y le permiten ganar un poco mas.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Alberto in his barber shop and videogames businesses. He owes the latter business to his last Kiva loan, which got it started. Now the neighborhood children are his main clients, and they get the opportunity to play on consoles they don't have at home.

Now Alberto is getting more attention, and so he says to his Kiva lenders, "Thank you for your economic collaboration in our activities."

Alberto now has plans to continue investing in growing his business, and so he has come back to Kiva to access more financing, which he will use to buy a more modern PlayStation, as the attraction of modern technology within reach for young people is what draws that sector of the market, who are his best clients and allow him to make a little more money.

loans.use: to buy a more modern PlayStation

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis, un hombre emprendedor , tiene 34 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa y dos hijos actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener un producto de buena calidad , la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: Luis is an enterprising man.  He is 34 years old, married and lives with his wife and two children.  Luis is applying for a loan as he wants to buy supplies, such as manure and fumigating chemicals.  He wants to support his coffee crops, in order to keep them in good condition as they grow - this will give him a higher quality product.  Luis' only limit in life is that he does not have enough money to continue to grow.  Luis depends on this work in order to prosper and so he is applying for a loan. This is his first loan with "FUDECOSUR".  He has no loans with state banks and "FUDECOSUR" is providing this loan under better conditions and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.en:
Mariela dreams of becoming a business administrator but without a degree knows it may never be possible. To achieve her goal, Mariela has enrolled in the Universidad Autónoma Juan Misael Saracho. She plans on graduating in December, 2014, but without a loan from Vittana she fears that she will need to defer her graduation. With this loan, Mariela plans on purchasing textbooks and other school-related items. With these supplies Mariela hopes to be able to better understand her subjects. 

Unfortunately, Mariela's parents never had the opportunity to complete their high school education. Without the opportunity for a higher degree, her parents never had the chance to move up. With one older sibling attending college already, Mariela is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a loan from Banco Fie. Mariela's father works as a farmer and his salary is the family's primary source of income.

To support her family and studies, Mariela currently works 30 hours a week in a bakery and has been doing so since the age of 16. One of her biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. With a career in business administration, she expects to earn $15 a day, a substantial increase from before.

loans.use: to purchase textbooks and other school-related items.

loans.name: Juan Marcos

texts.en:
Juan dreams of becoming a lawyer. To achieve his goal, Juan has enrolled in the Universidad Indigena Tawantinsuyus. He expects to graduate in December, 2014, but without a loan is unsure how he will be able to continue affording his education. He says that his alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until he could return. 

Juan says that it is important to him to graduate on time so he can enter into the job market as soon as possible. With this loan, Juan plans on paying his tuition while he saves money from his part-time job as an independent contractor. With a career in law, he expects to earn $20 a day, a substantial increase from before. 

For his family of four, finances have always been tight and Juan's parents were never able to complete their primary education. Juan is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Banco Fie loan.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 44 years old and married with one child.

Vincenta earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 15 years and also earns additional income from selling dried fish.

Vicenta is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF in order to purchase medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
As a married mother of 13 children, Tessie works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from selling bamboo and pottery. Tessie is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to buy more dried fish to sell.

Tessie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice-retailing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 17 years. Salvacion earns additional income from her general store.

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of rice to sell to customers.

Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of rice to sell to customers.

loans.name: Johna

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Johna works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Johna is borrowing 14,000 PHP (Philippines Pesos) through NWTF in order to purchase more dried fish to sell to customers.

Johna has been sustaining her business activities through her past fifteen loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money so she can continue to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Erlinda is 64 years old and has  children who are in school.

Erlinda has a dried fish-vending business in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a 29,500 PHP (Philippines Pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for forty-five years. In the future, Erlinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Lilita

texts.en:
Lilita is 47 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school. Lilita works very hard to provide for them.

Lilita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP (Philippines Pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like sugar, milk, coffee, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

Lilita has been in this business for two years.

In the future Lilita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like sugar, milk, coffee, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc

loans.name: Ashurbi

texts.ru: Ашурби жизнерадостная и трудолюбивая женщина в возрасте 47 лет. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Живёт она со своей семьёй в сельском посёлке. Вместе со своим мужем старается много работать, чтобы иметь достаточный доход на удовлетворение всех потребностей своей семьи. Сама Ашурби занимается купле продажей женской одежды. Она закупает на центральном рынке по оптовой цене одежду и привозит в свой посёлок, где продаёт свой товар местным жителям. Её товар пользуется большим спросом, и она получает от своего бизнеса хорошую прибыль. Также её муж работает в местной мастерской и получает дополнительный доход для своей семьи. Ашурби начала своё сотрудничество с Арванд несколько лет назад, она получала кредит на начало своего бизнеса и она является добросовестным клиентом. Сейчас Ашурби хочет закупить зимнюю одежду для продажи, так как начинается зимний сезон. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить очередной кредит на покупку одежды. Ашурби заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Ashurbi is a cheerful and hardworking woman of 47. She is married and has three children. She lives with her family in a rural village.  Both she and her husband work a lot to meet all the needs of their family. Ashurbi sells women’s clothing. She buys the clothing wholesale at the central market and brings them to her village, where she sells to the local residents. Her products are in great demand,and she earns a good profit  from her business. Her husband also works at a local shop and earns extra income for the family. Ashurbi began working with Arvand several years ago, and received a loan to get her business started and is an excellent client. Right now, since the winter season is beginning, Ashurbi wants to purchase winter clothing for sale. So she came to Arvand and would like to receive a another loan to purchase this clothing. Ashurbi thanks Arvand in advance for their financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy winter clothes

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 60 years old, married, and has eight children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 13 years. She earns additional income from a motorcycle transport business.

Nilda is requesting a loan from NWTF for 29,500 PHP, which she will use to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Segundina

texts.en:
Segundina is 62 years old and married. She has five children.

Segundina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from meat vending.

Segundina requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like sugar, rice, coffee, etc. to sell.

Segundina has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like sugar, rice, coffee, etc. to sell
